page.title: 03Life at Thorpe Marsh Reserve
page.content: {Thorpe Marsh Nature Reserve}is jointly owned by the{C.E.G.B.}and the {Yorkshire Wildlife Trust,}and they are most intrested in the animals there. The pond is a perfect picture with the coots running across the water like ghosts. In the reserve field office there is a display of stuffed birds.Under the names there are labels in braille so that there is a chance for blind people to get to know the birds.There are two resident wardens and 27 voluntary wardens.The voluntary wardens don't have special duties, but the resident wardens do. They make sure that the reserve is kept tidy, that things are not damaged, and also that there are no dogs on the reserve.
